name: wind turbine network connection construction, small-scale, 6kW, onshore | wind turbine network connection, small-scale, 6kW, onshore | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29882/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of the network connection for a small-scale wind turbine with a capacity of 6 kW. This connection connects one turbine to the low-voltage electricity network.;;;Dataset contains the following components:;•	Excavation for foundation and mains connection;•	Cable for mains connection (100m, 5x16mm² cable);•	Energy used in building machines

From the digging with an excavator, and from the reception and treatment of building materials.

This activity ends with the installation of the network connection. Decomissioning, in this case digging out the network cable is not included as it is assumed, that the cable stays in the ground. It is assumed that all parts will hold for the lifetime of 20 years and don't have to be replaced.

This dataset doesn't include neither the production and installation of the turbines inverter, nor the energy use for assembly of the different wind turbine parts nor their transportation from manufacture to the construction site
 (these data are included in the dataset of the wind turbines construction).
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2811:Manufacture of engines and turbines, except aircraft, vehicle and cycle eng

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The wind turbine from the corresponding dataset (construction of the turbine) has been produced since 2013, the development of the inventory took place in 2022.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The dataset represents data for the same geography as the corresponding datasets for wind turbine construction and electricity production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Connection to the low-voltage three-phase current electricity grid (400 V) with a cable-length of 100 m per turbine is assumed for network connection.;Cable size of 5*16mm² is used according [1].;;Cross section of the trench that is digged to put the cable below ground is an authors assumption to be 0,2 m wide and 0,6 m depth. ;;Literature sources:;[1] Kouloumpis, Victor; Sobolewski, Robert A.; Yan, Xiaoyu. Performance and life cycle assessment of a small scale vertical axis wind turbine. in Journal of Cleaner Production 247, 2020, article 119520.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data is specific for the network connection of a 6 kW small-scale wind turbine.

exchanges.description: 1 unit represents 100 m of laid cables for the network connection of the small-scale wind turbine including construction efforts

exchanges.description: Own assumptions. The excavated cable channel is assumed to have a width of 0,2 m and a depth of 0,6 m for a length of 100 m.
